data.title: Department of Theatre, Film, and Media Arts
data.meta_description: In an effort to demonstrate the department's commitment to diversity and inclusion, productions generated by individuals who have historically been excluded, including but not limited to women, artists of color, LGBTQ artists, and artists with disabilities, are indicated with an asterisk (*).
data.text:
Production History

In an effort to demonstrate the department's commitment to diversity and inclusion, productions generated by individuals who have historically been excluded, including but not limited to women, artists of color, LGBTQ artists, and artists with disabilities, are indicated with an asterisk (*).

2022 - 2023

*Men on Boats by Jacklyn Backhaus

The Country Wife by William Wycherley

*Wilderness by Seth Bockley and Anne Hamburger

*Everybody by Branden Jacobs-Jenkins

DigiEye, curated by Janet Parrott

Moving-Image Production Senior Showcase

2021 - 2022

*The Seagull by Anton Chekhov, adapted for the stage by Janice L. Blixt, translated from the Russian by Alexandra LaCombe

*In the Next Room (or the Vibrator Play) by Sarah Ruhl

*Sweat by Lynn Nottage

*Violet by Jeanine Tesori (music) and Brian Crawley (book and lyrics), based on the short story "The Ugliest Pilgrim" by Doris Betts

DigiEYE curated by Janet Parrott

Moving-Image Production Senior Showcase

2020 - 2021

In light of the COVID-19 pandemic, the department cancelled its planned 2020 - 2021 season. The faculty provided alternative theatrical experiences for its students including a performance over Zoom of Collective Rage: A Play in 5 Betties by Jen Silverman, a radio production of The Big Loop by Paul Bae, and various design installations. Projects by the MFA acting class of 2021 and by moving-image production majors were streamed online, including the 1st senior showcase by our undergraduate film-makers.
